alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 6:17PM EST until January 09 at 10:30PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN AMELIA, CUMBERLAND, PRINCE EDWARD, LUNENBURG, MECKLENBURG AND NOTTOWAY COUNTIES... At 617 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cumberland, Farmville, South Hill, Blackstone, Chase City, Crewe, Victoria, Kenbridge, Brodnax, Hampden Sydney College, Hampden Sydney, Longwood University, Nottoway, Lunenburg, Clarksville, La Crosse, Burkeville, Boydton, Rehoboth and Green Bay. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Cumberland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward
